Package oh_hecc.game_parts.metadata

Interface SharedMetadata

All Superinterfaces:
Heccable, Parseable
All Known Subinterfaces:
MetadataEditingInterface, MetadataReadingInterface
All Known Implementing Classes:
EditableMetadata
public interface SharedMetadata
extends Heccable, Parseable
A high-level interface for the Metadata class, holding things that are needed by its sub interfaces/high level functionality

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    static java.lang.String VALID_AUTHOR_REGEX
    Author name declared as '!author: Author name goes here' Must start with a letter, and must end in a letter (uppercase or lowercase) May have any number of letters (any case), full stops (for initials), commas (for multiple authors), and spaces
    static java.lang.String VALID_TITLE_REGEX
    The regex which titles must satisfy.

  • Field Details

    • VALID_AUTHOR_REGEX

      static final java.lang.String VALID_AUTHOR_REGEX
      Author name declared as '!author: Author name goes here' Must start with a letter, and must end in a letter (uppercase or lowercase) May have any number of letters (any case), full stops (for initials), commas (for multiple authors), and spaces
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • VALID_TITLE_REGEX

      static final java.lang.String VALID_TITLE_REGEX
      The regex which titles must satisfy. Titles are declared as '!StoryTitle: Title Goes Here' (the !StoryTitle: prefix is not present here though) Valid titles must start with 1 non-whitespace character, and end with 1 non-whitespace character. Any amount of non-whitespace characters and/or spaces are allowed between the start/end non-whitespace characters. Some horizontal whitespace permitted at very start/end, will be trimmed out anyway
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

  • Method Details

    • metadataRegexHandler

      static java.lang.String metadataRegexHandler​(java.lang.String regex, java.lang.String input) throws NoMatchException
      A method which does the metadata regex matching things
      Parameters:
      regex - the regular expression being looked for in the input
      input - the string that the regex is being applied to
      Returns:
      the string that was found by the regex from the input
      Throws:
      NoMatchException - if no match was found
